messages.content: What is the name of the resolution enacted by Crow Tribal Council in 1973?

In 1973, the Crow Tribal Council passed Resolution 74-05, which prohibited hunting and fishing within the Crow Reservation by anyone who was not a member of the Crow Tribe [resource](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3). This resolution directed officials to enforce the ordinance and any federal statute prohibiting hunting, fishing, and trespassing, but it did not apply to members of the Crow Tribe [resource](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3). Note that while passed in 1973, it is referred to as Resolution 74-05, suggesting implementation in 1974 [resource](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3).

web_research_result:
Based on the search results, here's what can be gathered regarding "Crow Tribal Council resolutions 1973 name":

*   **Government Structure:** Prior to 2001, the Crow Tribe of Montana was governed by a 1948 constitution that organized the tribe as a general council (tribal council) [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [crow-nsn](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1). This council held executive, legislative, and judicial powers and included all enrolled adult members (women 18+, men 21+) [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0). In 2001, a new constitution established a three-branch government [crow-nsn](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2) [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [crow-nsn](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1).

*   **Tribal Council/General Council:** Even after the 2001 changes, the general council technically remains the governing body [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0). However, it hasn't convened since July 15, 2001 [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0). The Executive Branch officials also serve within the Crow Tribal General Council [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0).

*   **Resolution 74-05 (Likely Enacted in 1973, Implemented in 1974):** In 1973, the Crow Tribal Council passed Resolution 74-05, which prohibited hunting and fishing within the reservation by anyone who was not a member of the Crow Tribe [resource](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3). This resolution directed officials to enforce the ordinance and any federal statute prohibiting hunting, fishing, and trespassing, but it did not apply to members of the Crow Tribe [resource](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3). The resolution was later challenged, with a court case addressing the tribe's power to proscribe hunting and fishing by non-members on fee patent lands where those non-members resided [resource](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3).

*   **Accessing Resolutions:** The Crow Tribe Legislative Branch website may contain links to current and historic Legislative Resolutions [ctlb](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4) [narf](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-5). Additionally, the Ann Big Man Collection at the Little Big Horn College Library contains Crow Tribal Council minutes and resolutions, including specific files for 1969-1972, 1973-1978, and selected resolutions from 1971-1974 [lbhc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6). The National Indian Law Library (NILL) also has resolutions available [narf](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-5).

*   **Other Relevant Information:**
    *   In 1973, the Indian voting age was lowered to eighteen to conform with the 26th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution [lbhc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7).
    *   A report was presented to the Crow Tribe in 1973 detailing the effects of coal mining on the reservation [umt](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-8).
